page.title: 19TRADE
page.content: SHOPS: There are village shops in Glasshouses, Low Laithe and Dacre. They sell a variety of groceries, and the store in Dacre which has been there for about 40 years also sells wines, spirits, cigarettes and Sunday newspapers. There is also a Post Office in Glasshouses which sells sweets and a few groceries. A local farmer from Wilsill delivers milk 6 days a week in Wilsill and Glasshouses and many other mobile shops visit the villages and sell fish, meat, vegetables and ice-creams. A mobile library comes once a week, and there are daily deliveries of the post and papers (by the postman) and once-weekly deliveries of the Sunday newspapers. For all other shopping the people of the area will either travel into Ripon or Harrogate and even further afield.
